Our Values

Come. See. Jesus

At The Life Place, our heartbeat is Jesus.

Our values shape who we are and how we live together as His people.

Hear the good news

Just as Jesus taught that everything in the Bible was written about Him, so every time we open the Bible, we are invited to see and meet with Him. And when we see Jesus, we hear the good news.

(Luke 24:47, John 1:19-35, 5:39, 46, 12:26-27, 13:3)

Diverse Community

Rooted in the good news, we celebrate every story, background, and culture—nations, tribes, peoples, and languages.

(Acts 2:46–47; Ephesians 3; Romans 8:15; Galatians 4:6; Revelation 7:9)

Extravagant Generosity

Made rich by what Jesus has done, we are generous and share in all things.

(Acts 2:45; 4:35; 2 Corinthians 8:2–4, 9, 16–24; 9:1–15)

Graceful Compassion

The good news moves us beyond our comforts to show grace to the widowed, the orphan, the poor, the imprisoned, and the immigrant.

(Deut 10:18; 14:29; 16:11; 24:17,19–21; Matt 25:35–36; Acts 6:1–3; Gal 2:9; James 1:27; 2:14–17; Jude 9)

Go live the story

In our homes, workplaces, and city, we embody the good news and engage the culture with grace and courage—not to condemn, but to redeem.

(John 17:15–19; Acts 17:16–34; 1 Corinthians 9:19–22)

“I came that they may have and enjoy life and have it in abundance (to the full, till it overflows)”

John 10:10 AMP
